work.name: Oracle (Cerner)
work.position: Technical Engagement Leader / Sr. Technical Engagement Leader
work.summary:
• Assumed the leadership for overall client technical project roadmap and domain strategy approach for Queensland Health (13k CCU, $15M contract for 5 years), Alfred Health (2.5k CCU, $100k+/m), and Western Health (18k CCU, $100k+/m)
  • Supported large-scale and complex client go-live events and related efforts (e.g. data center migration (RHO Flip))
  • Maintained client relationships and facilitate day-to-day operations and communications
  • Oversaw the success of client upgrades (e.g., Oracle 19c, Code upgrade, 724 etc.) and contractual obligation (e.g. DR testing)
  • Provided coordination and leadership to associates responsible for delivering the technical aspects of a client project
  • Coached and mentored other technical engagement leaders
  • Assisted and educated end users on proper techniques for system operation, and maintenance
  • Thrived within cross-cultural remote teams located in Australia, India, and the US
  • Engaged in hands-on troubleshooting and became lead of cloud onboarding, cloud migration script, and 724 upgrade.
  • Championed internal transition to Scrumban, documentation initiative, and tools adoption (Jira, IaC with GitHub, Zabbix, Splunk, JiraHelper, ACME)

work.name: Oracle (Cerner)
work.summary:
• Contributed to project implementation strategy and led domain environment strategy.I collaborated with the engagement management team to ensure timely delivery of the project to provide value to clients.I oversaw project scope,change process,test-issue management,and I ensured the team adherence to best practices and project methodology.
  • Coordinated design,system validation,integration activities or related workshops across solutions and venues of care and technical activities with the Technical Engagement Leader
  • Acted as the escalation point for project integration risk and issues
  • Managed Reference Data Domain Synchronization(RDDS)tool
  • Provided advanced troubleshooting coaching for front-end/backend communication,CCL script investigation,and code review.
  • Initiatives:Developed and promoted a graphical tool to represent program/domain plan(Excel VB);Improved test issue management workflow(PowerApps,MS Flow);Created an MS PowerBI Dashboard to display client and live solution across Australia to improve visibility for sales and account managers

work.name: Oracle (Cerner)
work.summary:
• Responsible for the Design,Implementation,Audit and Troubleshooting of the Patient Registration Solution(ERM)
  • Involved in troubleshooting ESM,CORE,FSI,CDS reporting,EKM rules
  • Improved standardisation across clients by improving rules documentation among the team
  • Created a script to export ERM conversation reducing the manual effort by 96%(5 min vs.120 min)
  • Best achievement was to resolve a data migration failure where 10000 records by creating a CCL script(10h vs.34d/p)

work.name: STMicroelectronics
work.summary: I planned and delivered a web solution to consolidate two e-form processes that tracked the quality of the production of silicon wafers. The process to create silicon wafers is long and any variation in steps outcome can lead to waste. Identifying issues early help reducing waste and cost. During the internship I interviewed internal customers, reported my weekly progress, and I conducted prototype testing workshops.

work.name: Orange
work.summary: I always reached and often exceeded my monthly sales goals.

work.name: Continental Automotive Systems
work.summary: I delivered two analysis to show differences between two existing information systems. This analysis aimed to define next steps of the project in order to migrate and consolidate one of the information system. I used UML diagrams (Use Case diagram; Class diagram; Sequence diagram; Communication diagram).

work.name: IT Tallaght
work.summary: I reversed engineered and delivered an educational software which taught implementation basis in 4 programming languages to university students (flowcharts; Turing machine; pseudo-code; assembly language). Once an algorithm was written, the user could run it step by step or in one go, and they could view their algorithm in the three other languages.

awards.title: Rising Start Program 2015
awards.summary: The program rewarded high achiever by providing one-on-one discussions with the UK leadership, which helped me understand all parts of the organization. We also worked with the GM to create a process and tool helping the board to review yearly initiatives.

awards.title: Innovation Award
awards.summary: Improve the visibility of Australian Clients footprint by consolidating data from multiple sources, creating PowerApp tool helping data custodian to review and update information, and providing a Power BI report accessible to all employees.
